# OpenDomainStrategy { #brdr.enums.OpenDomainStrategy }

```python
enums.OpenDomainStrategy()
```

Strategies for processing thematic areas not covered by reference data.

In GIS terms, this defines how the algorithm handles the 'Public Domain'
when the reference layer (e.g., land parcels) does not provide a target.

## Attributes {.doc-section .doc-section-attributes}

| Name                 | Type         | Description                                                                   |
|----------------------|--------------|-------------------------------------------------------------------------------|
| EXCLUDE              | [str](`str`) | Completely remove parts of the thematic geometry not on the reference layer.  |
| AS_IS                | [str](`str`) | Keep parts not covered by reference data unchanged in the result.             |
| SNAP_INNER_SIDE      | [str](`str`) | Snap everything within the relevant distance to the interior parcel boundary. |
| SNAP_ALL_SIDE        | [str](`str`) | Snap to both inner and outer boundaries where possible.                       |
| SNAP_PREFER_VERTICES | [str](`str`) | Snap to reference polygons, prioritizing vertices over edges.                 |
| SNAP_NO_PREFERENCE   | [str](`str`) | Snap to the closest reference component (edge or vertex) without bias.        |
| SNAP_ONLY_VERTICES   | [str](`str`) | Only allow snapping to existing vertices of the reference polygons.           |
